task.title: Adding a delegate host to a resource pool

taskbody.prereq: To perform this procedure, the root user on the master host has to gain access to the root user account on delegate hosts through Secure Shell (SSH). If the root user on delegate hosts are not configured for password access, configure them for key-based access before starting this procedure.
taskbody.context: Use this procedure to add one ore more delegate hosts to the default resource pool.

step.cmd: Log in to the master host .
Add a delegate host to the default resource pool.
step.info: If the master and delegate host are configured for key-based access, the following command does not prompt you to add the delegate to the list of known hosts, or to provide the password of the root user.
step.stepxmp:
Replace Hostname-Or-IP with the hostname or IP address of a delegate host: serviced host add --register Hostname-Or-IP:4979 default
If you use a hostname, all of the hosts in your cluster must be able to resolve the name, either through an entry in /etc/hosts or through a nameserver on the network.
Repeat this step for each delegate host in your cluster.
